registry.comment:
Copyright 2013-2020 The Khronos Group Inc. SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0
This file, gl.xml, is the OpenGL and OpenGL API Registry. The canonical version of the registry, together with documentation, schema, and Python generator scripts used to generate C header files for OpenGL and OpenGL ES, can always be found in the Khronos Registry at https://github.com/KhronosGroup/OpenGL-Registry

type.comment: Not an actual GL type, though used in headers in the past

types.type: typedef void ( *GLDEBUGPROC)(GLenum source,GLenum type,GLuint id,GLenum severity,GLsizei length,const GLchar *message,const void *userParam);
typedef void ( *GLDEBUGPROCARB)(GLenum source,GLenum type,GLuint id,GLenum severity,GLsizei length,const GLchar *message,const void *userParam);
typedef void ( *GLDEBUGPROCKHR)(GLenum source,GLenum type,GLuint id,GLenum severity,GLsizei length,const GLchar *message,const void *userParam);
typedef void ( *GLDEBUGPROCAMD)(GLuint id,GLenum category,GLenum severity,GLsizei length,const GLchar *message,void *userParam);

enum.name: GL_ALL_ATTRIB_BITS
enum.comment: Guaranteed to mark all attribute groups at once

enums.comment: GL_{DEPTH,ACCUM,STENCIL,COLOR}_BUFFER_BIT also lie in this namespace

enum.name: GL_COVERAGE_BUFFER_BIT_NV
enum.comment: Collides with AttribMask bit GL_HINT_BIT. OK since this token is for OpenGL ES 2, which doesn't have attribute groups.

enums.comment: Should be shared with WGL/GLX, but aren't since the FORWARD_COMPATIBLE and DEBUG values are swapped vs. WGL/GLX.
For NV_transform_feedback. No clue why small negative values are used
Tokens whose numeric value is intrinsically meaningful

enum.name: GL_INVALID_INDEX
enum.comment: Tagged as uint

enum.name: GL_TIMEOUT_IGNORED
enum.comment: Tagged as uint64

enum.name: GL_TIMEOUT_IGNORED_APPLE
enum.comment: Tagged as uint64

enum.name: GL_VERSION_ES_CL_1_0
enum.comment: Not an API enum. API definition macro for ES 1.0/1.1 headers

enum.name: GL_VERSION_ES_CM_1_1
enum.comment: Not an API enum. API definition macro for ES 1.0/1.1 headers

enum.name: GL_VERSION_ES_CL_1_1
enum.comment: Not an API enum. API definition macro for ES 1.0/1.1 headers

enums.comment: Mostly OpenGL 1.0/1.1 enum assignments. Unused ranges should generally remain unused.

unused.comment: Experimental (internal/test only) range. DO NOT SHIP VALUES IN THIS RANGE.

enums.comment: The primary GL enumerant space begins here. All modern enum allocations are in this range. These enums are mostly assigned the default class since it's a great deal of not very useful work to be more specific

unused.comment: GL_WRAP_BORDER = 0x8152 was proposed, but not actually promoted to core
GL_DEPTH_BUFFER = 0x8223 not actually used in the API
GL_STENCIL_BUFFER = 0x8224 not actually used in the API

enum.name: GL_ACTIVE_PROGRAM_EXT
enum.comment: For the OpenGL ES version of EXT_separate_shader_objects

enum.name: GL_AUTO_GENERATE_MIPMAP
enum.comment: Should be deprecated

enum.name: GL_ROBUST_GPU_TIMEOUT_MS_KHR
enum.comment: Reserved for future

enums.comment: Most of this could be reclaimed

enum.name: GL_PACK_RESAMPLE_SGIX
enum.comment: Formerly 0x842C in SGI specfile

enum.name: GL_UNPACK_RESAMPLE_SGIX
enum.comment: Formerly 0x842D in SGI specfile

enum.name: GL_RESAMPLE_DECIMATE_SGIX
enum.comment: Formerly 0x8430 in SGI specfile

enum.name: GL_RESAMPLE_REPLICATE_SGIX
enum.comment: Formerly 0x842E in SGI specfile

enum.name: GL_RESAMPLE_ZERO_FILL_SGIX
enum.comment: Formerly 0x842F in SGI specfile

unused.comment: Unknown 3Dlabs private extension for Autodesk (but we know the enum values)

enum.name: GL_PROGRAM_BINDING_ARB
enum.comment: NOT an alias. Accidental reuse of GL_MAP2_VERTEX_ATTRIB7_4_NV

enum.name: GL_Z400_BINARY_AMD
enum.comment: NOT an alias. Accidental reuse of GL_DOT3_RGB_EXT

enum.name: GL_PROGRAM_BINARY_LENGTH_OES
enum.comment: NOT an alias. Accidental reuse of GL_DOT3_RGBA_EXT

enum.name: GL_DEBUG_OBJECT_MESA
enum.comment: NOT an alias. Accidental reuse of GL_TEXTURE_1D_STACK_MESAX

enum.name: GL_DEBUG_PRINT_MESA
enum.comment: NOT an alias. Accidental reuse of GL_TEXTURE_2D_STACK_MESAX

enum.name: GL_DEBUG_ASSERT_MESA
enum.comment: NOT an alias. Accidental reuse of GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_1D_STACK_MESAX

enum.name: GL_COMPRESSED_LUMINANCE_ALPHA_3DC_ATI
enum.comment: Defined by Mesa but not ATI

unused.comment: Should have been assigned to PROGRAM_BINDING_ARB

enum.name: GL_ACTIVE_PROGRAM_EXT
enum.comment: For the OpenGL version of EXT_separate_shader_objects

enum.name: GL_TEXTURE_BUFFER_BINDING
enum.comment: Equivalent to GL_TEXTURE_BUFFER_ARB query, but named more consistently

enums.comment: For Affie Munshi. Reassigned from AMD to QCOM (bug 5874)

unused.comment: Removed 2005/09/26 in revision #117 of the FBO extension spec
Removed 2005/05/31 in revision #113 of the FBO extension spec
Was for GL_STENCIL_INDEX_EXT, but now use core STENCIL_INDEX instead
Was GL_TEXTURE_IMMUTABLE_LEVELS in draft ES 3.0 spec

enums.comment: For Jon Kennedy, Khronos public bug 75
For Mark Callow, Khronos bug 4055. Shared with EGL.
RESERVED FOR FUTURE ALLOCATIONS BY KHRONOS
Unused, unlikely to ever be used
IBM is out of the graphics hardware business. Most of this range will remain unused.
NEC may be out of the graphics hardware business?
Kubota Pacific is out of business
Portland Graphics was acquired by Template Graphics, which is out of business
Evans and Sutherland is out of the graphics hardware business

type.name: GLclampf
type.comment: No longer used in GL 1.1, but still defined in Mesa gl.h

type.name: GLclampd
type.comment: No longer used in GL 1.1, but still defined in Mesa gl.h

require.comment: Promoted from ARB_imaging subset to core

remove.comment: Compatibility-only GL 1.0 features removed from GL 3.2
Compatibility-only GL 1.1 features removed from GL 3.2
Compatibility-only GL 1.2 features removed from GL 3.2
Compatibility-only GL 1.3 features removed from GL 3.2
Compatibility-only GL 1.4 features removed from GL 3.2
Compatibility-only GL 1.5 features removed from GL 3.2
Compatibility-only GL 2.0 features removed from GL 3.2
Compatibility-only GL 2.1 features removed from GL 3.2
Compatibility-only GL 3.0 features removed from GL 3.2

require.comment: Reuse tokens from ARB_vertex_attrib_64bit - all are in GL 3.0 and 4.0 already
Reuse tokens from ARB_viewport_array - some are in GL 1.1 and ARB_provoking_vertex already
Reuse tokens from ARB_arrays_of_arrays (none, GLSL only)
Reuse tokens from ARB_fragment_layer_viewport (none, GLSL only)
Reuse tokens from ARB_shader_image_size (none, GLSL only)

enum.name: GL_VERTEX_BINDING_BUFFER
enum.comment: Added in 2013/10/22 update to the spec

require.comment: Reuse commands from ARB_arrays_of_arrays (none, GLSL only)
Reuse commands from ARB_fragment_layer_viewport (none, GLSL only)
Reuse commands from ARB_shader_image_size (none, GLSL only)
Reuse commands from KHR_debug (includes ARB_debug_output commands promoted to KHR without suffixes)
KHR_debug functionality not supported in core profile
Restore functionality removed in GL 3.2 core to GL 4.3. Needed for debug interface.
Not used by the API, for compatibility with old gl.h
Not used by the API, for compatibility with old gl2.h
Not used by the API; put here so this type doesn't need to be declared in gl2ext.h
Not used by the API, for compatibility with old gl2.h
Not used by the API, but could be used by applications
Supported only if GL_EXT_direct_state_access is supported

enum.name: GL_MAX_SPARSE_ARRAY_TEXTURE_LAYERS
enum.comment: Should have an AMD suffix, but probably too late now

require.comment: This is an alias for the following extensions. At present gl.xml doesn't actually replicate all their interfaces here.
Depends on TexStorage* (EXT_texture_storage / ES 3.0 / GL 4.4 / etc.)
Depends on TexStorage* (EXT_texture_storage / ES 3.0 / GL 4.4 / etc.)
Defines features from OpenGL 3.0 that were removed in OpenGL 3.1 - not enumerated here yet

extension.name: GL_ARB_imaging
extension.comment: Now treating ARB_imaging as an extension, not a GL API version

require.comment: Supported only if GL_ARB_ES3_compatibility is supported
Supported only if GL_KHR_texture_compression_astc_ldr is supported
Supported only if GL_EXT_direct_state_access is supported
Supported only if GL_ARB_direct_state_access or GL 4.5 is supported

extension.name: GL_ATI_pixel_format_float
extension.comment: WGL extension defining some associated GL enums. ATI does not export this extension.

require.comment: Supported only if GL_EXT_direct_state_access, ARB_direct_state_access, or OpenGL 4.5 are supported

extension.name: GL_EXT_direct_state_access
extension.comment: DSA extension doesn't identify which interfaces are core profile and keeps getting expanded. This is in sync with revision 34, 2010/09/07

require.comment: OpenGL 1.3: New compressed texture object commands
OpenGL 1.3: New multitexture compressed texture commands
OpenGL 3.0: New buffer data copy command
OpenGL 3.0: New vertex array specification commands for VAO
OpenGL 3.0: New vertex array enable commands for VAO
OpenGL 3.0: New vertex attrib array enable commands for VAO

command.name: glDrawRangeElementsBaseVertexEXT
command.comment: Supported only if OpenGL ES 3.0 is supported

command.name: glDrawElementsInstancedBaseVertexEXT
command.comment: Supported only if OpenGL ES 3.0 is supported

command.name: glMultiDrawElementsBaseVertexEXT
command.comment: Supported only if GL_EXT_multi_draw_arrays is supported

require.comment: Duplicated in GL_NV_vertex_program4 since both extensions list these functions and tokens
Supported only if GL_EXT_direct_state_access is supported
Supported only if GL_EXT_direct_state_access is supported
The OpenGL version of this extension is completely unrelated to the OpenGL ES version
The OpenGL ES version of this extension is completely unrelated to the OpenGL version
Depends on OpenGL ES 3.0 or GL_NV_non_square_matrices

extension.name: GL_EXT_texture_cube_map
extension.comment: Replaced by ARB_texture_cube_map, but was apparently shipped anyway?

require.comment: Not clear all of these enums should be here for OpenGL ES. Many are only defined if other extensions also requiring them are supported
Supported only if GL_EXT_direct_state_access is supported
Otherwise identical to GL_KHR_blend_equation_advanced, just different semantic behavior
KHR extensions *mandate* suffixes for ES, unlike for GL
KHR extensions *mandate* suffixes for ES, unlike for GL
KHR extensions *mandate* suffixes for ES, unlike for GL

extension.name: GL_KHR_texture_compression_astc_ldr
extension.comment: API is identical to GL_KHR_texture_compression_astc_hdr extension

require.comment: Otherwise identical to GL_NV_blend_equation_advanced, just different semantic behavior
Some NV_fragment_program entry points are shared with ARB_vertex_program
Supported only if GL_EXT_direct_state_access is supported
Supported only if GL_EXT_direct_state_access is supported
Supported only if GL_EXT_direct_state_access is supported
Other API additions of unknown history
Supported only if GL_EXT_direct_state_access is supported
Immediate-mode entry points don't exist in ES 1.x

command.name: glDrawRangeElementsBaseVertexOES
command.comment: Supported only if OpenGL ES 3.0 is supported

command.name: glDrawElementsInstancedBaseVertexOES
command.comment: Supported only if OpenGL ES 3.0 is supported

command.name: glMultiDrawElementsBaseVertexEXT
command.comment: Supported only if GL_EXT_multi_draw_arrays is supported

require.comment: Entry points not in the extension spec, but in the Khronos glext.h. Included for backward compatibility.
Entry points in the extension spec, but not the Khronos glext.h. Correspond to GL-only features it's unlikely were ever implemented against ES 1.x.

extension.name: GL_OES_texture_compression_astc
extension.comment: API is identical to GL_KHR_texture_compression_astc_hdr extension
